resources.string:
K-TEA is a mobile application developed for KTDA to automate the services the organization delivers to its small-scale tea farmers. 
 Due to the notable increase in the number of small-scale tea farmers, the organization aims to improve its service delivery to ensure complete 'customer' satisfaction.
 The app aims at:
 -> Tracking farmer tea-weights monthly and annually to help curb tea-weight falsification and weight reductions.
 -> Helping farmers with loan applications and repayments.(GREEN-FEDHA LOANS)
 -> Informing its users (tea-farmers) about Majani Insurance, its payment plans, rates and in registration.
 -> Creating a module through which tea farmers can apply for farm inputs (fertilisers).

Greenland Fedha Limited (GFL) is a non deposit taking micro finance institution, wholly owned by Kenya Tea Development Agency Holdings Limited. GFL mandate is to provide a variety of affordable financial services to the low income households in the teas sub sector. \n Membership to GFL is voluntary. \n
GFL is a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya.
Sale and harvest of Mature Eucalyptus Trees
Tender for sale of 300 Acres Land in Transmara.
Tender for Transportation of bagged fertilizers.
Tender announcement for Sale and harvest of Mature Eucalyptus Trees at Gitumba farm in Muranga county and at the KTDA farms in Kangaita
Tender announcement for Sale of a 300 acres land in Trasmara, Narok county by Tombe Tea factory company.
Tender for Transportation of bagged fertilizers.
KTDA Foundation,Taylors of Harrogate and partners open up Ndarwetta community spring
KTDA partners with Kenya Forest to Reafforest the Mau
KTDA Foundation opens up Medical camp at Tombe
KTDA signs KSH 700M deal with PROPARCO
KTDA to launch mobile app automating services to its small-scale tea farmers
The second payment (Bonus) disbursement and the September payments will be released to farmer"s banks by October 13TH
Appreciation message to our customers and partners. #Happy customer care week

KTDA Foundation,Taylors of Harrogate and partners open up Ndarwetta community spring. The project has also led to the setting up of a carwash/motorbike shade and a water trough where animals will drink.

KTDA partners with Kenya Forest to Re-afforest the Mau. In partnership with KFS, 16 KTDA factories embarked on a reafforestation programme of the Mau, a key water tower thats under threat of deforestation.
KTDA Foundation opens up Medical camp at Tombe
KTDA signs KSH 700M deal with PROPARCO. The amount will be used for the expansion of orthodox lines in four factories: Kimunye, Gitugi,Imenti and Thumaiti.
KTDA to launch mobile app automating services to its small-scale tea farmers.
